CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 27, 1956, pg. A1, reads: "Kiddies Meet Eleanor - A group of Addison Terrace youngsters abandoned their playtoys and games during the afternoon of Oct. 18 to know and get close to Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt, second from left, when she dedicated a monument bought and erected for her late husband, President Franklin D. Roosevelt by tenants of Addison Terrace in 1946. Later that evening she addressed a democratic rally in Schenley High School Auditorium. - Harris Photo." Inscription on monument reads: "In Memory of Franklin Delano Roosevelt - He Dedicated These Homes Oct. 11, 1940 - Erected by the People of Addison Terrace July 4, 1946 - Gone But Not Forgotten"
TitMainTitle: Eleanor Roosevelt and group of children gathered around monument dedicated to President Franklin Delano Roosevelt, with police officer on far right, Addison Terrace, Hill District
